definition: A concentrated coffee brewed by forcing hot water through finely-ground coffee beans under pressure.
An Italian coffee drink prepared with espresso, steamed milk, and milk foam in equal proportions.
A coffee drink made with espresso and steamed milk, with a light layer of foam on top.
An espresso with a small amount of foamed milk, literally meaning 'marked' or 'stained'.
Espresso with added hot water, giving it a similar strength to drip coffee but different flavor.
The golden-brown foam that forms on top of a properly brewed espresso, indicating quality.
The process of pulling espresso, typically lasting 25-30 seconds for optimal flavor.
The weight and texture of coffee in your mouth, ranging from light to full-bodied.
The bright, tangy quality in coffee that adds liveliness and complexity to the flavor.
Equal parts espresso and steamed milk, 'cut' to reduce the acidity of the espresso.
